clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of The Effect of Live Probiotic Cultures Present in Fermented Dairy Product (Yogurt) Versus The Effect of Freeze-Dried Probiotic Sachets on Gingival Bleeding of Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Freeze-Dried Probiotic Sachets Versus Fermented Dairy Product (Yogurt) on Gingival Bleeding on Brushing in Adolescents (12-15) Years Old : A Randomized Clinical Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effect of probiotics supplied in two different forms (dairy products containing probiotics as yogurt and freeze-dried synthetic probiotics sachets) on improving gingival condition and caries potentiality of dental plaque in adolescents

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Gingival bleeding On Brushing
primary_outcome.description: Patient questioning and answering with yes or no on a questionnaire

secondary_outcome.description: Pooled plaque sample (pH meter) on scale (1-14)

intervention.description: The participants will be instructed to consume the sachets as follow, each sachet powder is mixed with 10 ml of water in a measuring cup, then swish the mixture in the mouth for one minute before swallowing. This procedure will be repeated once daily for the following 4 weeks. 4 weeks supply will be given to the participants.

The participants will be instructed to consume the yogurt once daily regularly for the following 4 weeks. 4 weeks supply will be given to the participants with instruction to store the yogurt in refrigerator at home

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Children aged 12-15 years old
2. Children complaining from gingival problems
3. Medically free children
4. Children not registered in other clinical researches
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Children with systemic diseases, mental disorders, chronic debilitating diseases.
2. Children using antibiotic treatment during the study
3. Children with orthodontic treatment
4. Children using antimicrobial mouthwash
5. Children taking any probiotic supplemental therapy
